reviews.review: it gud

Just finished playing this game and I gotta say, hands down a true masterpiece. The setting, art, exploration and battle system of the game was truly worth every hour spent playing this beauty. Everything was just absolutely perfect. Gonna play it again for a second run!

[h1]  Just finished the game and thought I should write about it.... DAMN..! [/h1]

Graphics: 
Awesome, but it also really depends of the computer or the settings. Either way the developers really tried to go into details.

Bugs:
Very minor, (sometimes objects go throught walls when [spoiler] Elizabeth throws them [/spoiler] ). <---- just a minor spoiler
I hadn't seen any others tho so if you want write a comment about bugs that you had that I hadn't seen, I will add it for other people to see.

Gameplay:
Oh my [strike] fu*king [/strike] god.... No words just play the game. But in one word.. AWESOME. And the ending tho... total [strike] mindfu*k [/strike]

Characters: ( click only if you want to see the character names and personalities! )
[spoiler] Oh i fu*king love Elizabeth and the twins are so fucking amazing too. I think that irattional games couldnt pick a better "person" than Booker DeWitt as the main character. Also I think that Elizabeth is the best fucking companion you can have. ;) [/spoiler]

Overall sh*t and stuff: 

My god this game is AMAZING. I never really liked single-player games more than the multiplayer ones but this one restored my faith in them. 

Graphics: 9/10 (considering the bug)
Gameplay: Elizabeth/10 (11/10)
Characters: 9.9/10 ( [spoiler] I think that there were only around 5 designs of the basic soldiers, not including the Vox [/spoiler] )
Overall: 9.96/10 ( yeah I used calculator)

After all, I really recomend this game to all kinda sci-fi-fantasy lovers.... FUCK IT JUST BUY THIS GAME!!! (even if you don't like single-player games, or at least try it and you can get a refund, the game will however, get the most interesting after 2 hours which is past the limit) 

Alright than... If you want to say something to me write me a message or if you hadn't liked this review write a comment to let me know  so I could improve in writing other reviews. Thank you. 

Beware of the dangerous world outside and stay healed my friends

(also sorry about the lenght and my english)

The game play isn't quite the same as the previous Bioshock games but it is still amazing. The storyline connecting to the other Bioshock games amazed me. The game isn't as "dark" as the first two games but it still has its' twisted story. This game also seems a lot more lively and fast-paced.
Still a good game overall, however it lost the essence of the bioshock games a bit in almost every aspect, it's watered down.

I RECCOMEND THIS GAME SIMPLY BECAUSE IT'S STILL A SOLID SHOOTER WITH DECENT STORY BUT I DETAIL MANY PROBLEMS BELOW. If we had number ratings I'd give this game a 7/10.

tldr : The game is a very solid shooter and a good story (I enjoyed the original Bioshocks more , but it's still decent). However, the game has many graphical, audio and other bugs that just annoyed me and even forced me to restart the game sometimes. ( Read below for details) I picked up this game along with the season pass for $14.99. I'd say even off sale this game is a decent buy, but if you're looking for the original Bioshock magic it's not really here (except for the DLCs which do take place in Rapture and feel more like the games i knew and loved).

Gameplay : The combat is great . Guns are varied and fun , customizable with different upgrades. There's plenty of environmental traps to use , different paths to take and combinations of powers and guns to use. Exploration is rewarded with extra loot , finding little audio recordings that give you insight into more lore , side objectives , etc. Sadly some things seem rushed , in this game you get a companion character (Elizabeth) who follows you around. Sometimes her pathing just gets really janky and she may get stuck unless you "nudge" her move. Sometimes she blocks doors and wont move out of the way, one time i actually got the game stuck by accidentally getting between her and a scripted event , causing me to get stuck and the game unable to continue. Then while playing in the DLC I jumped up a small ledge and got myself stuck between two pillars and couldn't escape. So it's got "those" problems. Also lack of a map REALLY annoyed me in this game , makes it harder for casual players to explore.

Graphics : The game takes a very different direction in terms of atmosphere and color tone than Bioshocks 1-2 . While Bioshock 1-2 was more dreary , creepy and almost scary , infinite makes everything more bright , even peaceful at times. So if you're looking for that original Bioshock feel , it's kinda.. missing here. It does show up abit later into the game (and for sure in the DLCs!) , but it'll still look nice to anyone who isn't looking for that. However there are also times when you'll see your companion (Elizabeth) glitch out for very brief seconds and look like she's being crumpled up like a paper before returning to normal.

Audio : Alot of problems here. Sound seems broken in this game. Something will sound like it's to my right but i can clearly see it on my left. Ambience cuts in and out when you walk through certain places. Audio lines sometimes overlap (same character saying two different things at once).

HANDS DOWN MY FAVORITE BIOSHOCK GAME (in my opinion). The game was great. Great story, great gameplay, lots of guns, and more open world style compared to the previous Bioshock games. Some of the guns are just for show (Mainly the Vox weapons) but other than that i highly recommend trying this game out.

just finished this game , and i hate it .It had a great start which excited me , the gameplay was okay with no stealth factor included like zero stealth you can sneak up on an enemy but cannot stealthily execute them , it has to be a drawn out slug fest of shooting and melees with our magnetic hand grinder ,which also allows you attach to hooks and travel on wires and vigors which were a bit helpful.The story line was the factor that messed me up the most , again the start of the game was great , the bridge of the story line was drawn out and the ending ........ The ending ruined me it still keeps me up at night , it made me so angry i felt like destroying my set up and smashing  some plates. Do not buy this game colossal waste of time.

What an amazing game. Definitively one of the best games that I played recently and one of the best games that I ever played for sure. Amazing story and the plot twists in the end.... just incredible. Definitively recommend it. Worth every cent.

Post Burial at Sea: I though that this game couldn't become better but jesus christ that burial at sea ep 2, just amazing. The way the ties with the original Bioshock so well is incredible.

probably one of the best games ever made.

I tried to like this game, but if you're a fan of the first two BioShock games, you might not like this one. The change in scenery is too much for me. The story of Colombia was never told well. Elizabeth is cool and helpful, but her powers contribute nothing more than introducing small changes to your environment when you're fighting enemies. The powers for your character are pretty awful compared to plasmids and the weapons feel underpowered, underwhelming, and the combat in general is too open and easy.

This game was praised for its graphics at the time but I just never saw it. I'd rather play BioShock for an hour than try to play through this game in its entirety. The ending was cool, but it does feel forced when I look back on it.

Fun game if you're new, but as other reviews have stated "Whatever the hell this is, it ain't BioShock."

One of the most fun games I've played. The final level with the ship and the crazy bird was hard work but all through this game I had fun. The enemies are fun, the weapons are fun, the story is fun, the animations are fun, it is a pretty game and all those reviews from so called Games Journalists were all bent on how you the man are the hero while Elizabeth is a pitiful little sidekick...well. You cant progress without her. She unlocks doors, she opens portals, she throws you ammo and health packs. The story revolves all around her and she's cute.  I had a blast playing this and the price drops during sales so it is really worth every penny. The story also wraps around back to earlier Bioshock's which was very nice to see, it is a fascinating story and the two character that you meet who travel through time and space to meet you are off their head whack jobs. British Victorian era eccentric loonies, I adored them.

Story is mindblowing. You have to try it by yourself honestly.

It's so hard to describe. It'll blow your mind lol.

Whilst it's nowhere near the height of the series, it's a fun enough game. Whilst it'll probably say I've played more of this than the other two, due to owning differing copies and getting the remasters that'd be false. The world is okay, the sky world looks pretty and the world fair style is sorta endearing. However it's mostly just pretty and I don't feel as invested as I did in the other games. I don't care as much interestingly about Booker as I do about Bioshock ones protagonist. 

Every character from small to large is sort of just fine. The world feels less fleshed out and the story plainer, though the concepts are a little deeper. Powers and weapons are a major step back and gunplay whilst a little slicker feels like a major step back. The fact you can only carry two weapons over the original 9 or 10 is also a bit plain and means you can only approach situations in a very flat way. The powers equally are way flatter than the others in the series. 

I can't call it a bad game. I would say it's worth it on sale, there's more going for it than most games and you'll have a good time... but compared to bioshock 1 and even 2 I find it less enjoyable, though particularly with the former you just can't beat it.
JUEGASO <3
Nice game

Wow! Just wow! This game is fun, action-packed, fast-paced at appropriate moments, slow-paced at appropriate moments, has a story that has engaged throughout the whole game, etc. You will either be thinking "seems like this is leading up to something but I bet it won't happen" and it happens or some completely different happens. I have "technically" a low-end laptop, yet this game runs like butter! Although there are some glitches in the game, you will be tricked in most of the time into thinking its normal only to play it again and realize it is not but does not diminish from the experience in the slightest.

If you are hesitating to buy this, just do it! There's drama, humor, horror, action, etc.!
